oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Vibrational excitation cross-sections u(n <- m)(E) in resonant e-N-2, e-CO and e-H-2 scattering are calculated from transition matrix elements T-n <- m(E) obtained using Fourier transform of the cross correlation function <phi(R)psi(m)(R,t)> where psi(m)(R,t); e(-iHA-(R)t/h)phi(m)(R) . Time evolution under the influence of the resonance anionic Hamiltonian H-A-(A(-)=N-2(-)/CO/H-2(-)) is effected using Lanczos and fast Fourier transforms and the target (A) vibrational eigenfunctions phi(m)(R) and phi(n)(R) are calculated using Fourier grid Hamiltonian method applied to PE curve of the neutral target. The resulting vibrational excitation cross-section profiles provide reasonable agreement with experimental results and the cross correlation functions offer an unequivocal differentiation between the boomerang and impulse models.
